aws::graph::propositions: # Aviation Accident Information for Piper PA60 in Salt Lake City
The accident occurred in Salt Lake City, Utah.
The accident occurred on November 8, 2019.
The accident occurred at 18:20 Local time.
The aircraft involved was a Piper PA60.
The defining event was collision during takeoff/land.
The flight was conducted under Part 91: General aviation.
The accident number was GAA20CA085.
The aircraft registration was N914MB.
The aircraft sustained substantial damage.
There was 1 person involved in the accident.
There were no injuries in the accident.
The pilot landed about 10 knots faster than normal.
The pilot did not follow the taxi centerline guide while exiting the runway.
The pilot taxied right of the centerline.
The pilot taxied right of the centerline to reach the taxiway as soon as possible.
The pilot was momentarily distracted while adjusting the radio.
The pilot was attempting to leave the runway when he was distracted.
The pilot recaptured the taxiway centerline after completing the right turn.
The pilot parked the airplane after recapturing the taxiway centerline.
The pilot found damage to the pressurized cabin during his preflight inspection the next morning.
The pilot found damage to the right propeller during his preflight inspection the next morning.
The right propeller had struck a taxiway light.
The taxiway light was dislodged by the impact.
The propeller blade tip was broken off.
The propeller blade tip had struck the cabin.
The airplane sustained substantial damage to the cabin.
There were no preaccident mechanical failures with the airplane.
There were no preaccident mechanical malfunctions with the airplane.
The National Transportation Safety Board determined the probable cause of the accident.
The probable cause was the pilot's failure to follow the taxiway centerline guide.
The probable cause included the pilot's distraction due to adjusting the radio.
The pilot failed to maintain clearance from a taxiway light after landing.
The pilot failed to maintain clearance from a taxiway light while taxiing to a ramp.

text:
# Aviation Investigation Final Report

## Location:
Salt Lake City, Utah

## Date & Time: 
November 8, 2019, 18:20 Local

## Aircraft:
Piper PA60

## Defining Event:
Collision during takeoff/land

## Flight Conducted Under:
Part 91: General aviation

## Accident Number:
GAA20CA085

## Registration:
N914MB

## Aircraft Damage:
Substantial

## Injuries:
1 None

## Analysis

The pilot reported that, during the night landing, he landed about 10 knots faster than normal and that, while exiting the runway, he did not follow the taxi centerline guide but instead taxied right of the centerline so that he could reach the taxiway as soon as possible. He was momentarily distracted while adjusting the radio as he was attempting to leave the runway. After completing the right turn, he recaptured the taxiway centerline and parked the airplane. During his preflight inspection the next morning, he found damage to the pressurized cabin and the right propeller. Upon further examination, the pilot noted that the right propeller had struck a taxiway light, which had dislodged the light and broken off the blade tip, and that the propeller blade tip had struck the cabin. The airplane sustained substantial damage to the cabin. The pilot reported that there were no preaccident mechanical failures or malfunctions with the airplane that would have precluded normal operation.

## Probable Cause and Findings

The National Transportation Safety Board determines the probable cause(s) of this accident to be:

The pilot's failure to follow the taxiway centerline guide and his distraction due to adjusting the radio, which resulted in his failure to maintain clearance from a taxiway light after landing and while taxiing to a ramp.

---
